byline.original: By SHARON OTTERMAN and SAMANTHA SCHMIDT

abstract: Archdiocese of New York announce it has launched program that allows victims of sexual abuse by clergy members to apply for compensation, even if claims are decades old; Cardinal Timothy Dolan says plan was inspired by Pope Francis, and that he hoped it become model for other dioceses to help victims heal.

keywords.value: Survivors Network of Those Abused by Priests
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The independent commission will allow victims of abuse by clergy members to apply for monetary compensation from the church, even for claims that are decades old, church leaders said.
